definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
to set a box office record

sentences.english: With the same as Hollywood, the star is the important insurance ofthe Hong Kong movie booking office.
sentences.chinese: 与好莱圬一样，明星是香港电影票房的重要保证。

sentences.english: The autumn crop is far more prone to failure than the summer one.
sentences.chinese: 可以预计的是秋季票房收入比夏季还要惨淡。

sentences.english: 3-D ticket sales made up 64% of the box office.
3-D ticket sales made up 64% of the box office.
That first movie began with a $70.5 million weekend.
sentences.chinese: 第一集放映时周末票房收入为7050万美元。

sentences.english: No active fighter can come close to equaling De La Hoya's name recognition and earning power.
sentences.chinese: 没有一个现役拳手能够媲美霍亚的名声和票房。

sentences.english: The Ice Storm and Ride with the Devil saw fairly mild box office success.
sentences.chinese: 但《冰风暴》和《与魔鬼共骑》的票房并不理想。

sentences.english: The play has no box-office appeal.
It has reigned at the top of North American box office for six weeks.
sentences.chinese: «阿凡达»统治北美票房达六个星期。

sentences.english: So it was called "box office flop".
Secondly, now in Japan, Cheon JH's new movie is doing quite well.
sentences.chinese: 第二，目前全知贤的新片在日本票房非常的好。

sentences.english: Driving this growth is a massive movie-theater-building spree.
sentences.chinese: 推动票房收入大增是大规模的电影院建设潮。

sentences.english: The movie became a box-office record breaker.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影打破了先前的票房纪录。

sentences.english: Out of the box the ONE does not included Speed and Red-light cameras.
sentences.chinese: 出于对票房的一个不包括速度和冲红灯摄影机。

sentences.english: Was the champion of HK and Singapore box office.
sentences.chinese: 香港和新加坡票房荣登同期港产票房冠军。

sentences.english: Was the champion of HK and Singapore box office.
sentences.chinese: 香港和新加坡票房荣登同期港产票房冠军。

definition: (of a movie, show etc) to attract large audiences
theater chain (abbr. for 電影院線|电影院线)
to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
